intro: Euphrasia maximowiczii var. yezoensis, commonly known as Yezo eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the Korean Peninsula and parts of northeastern Japan. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive hairy texture and is often found in cool, temperate climates. Yezo eyebright is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
